description: The Attribute Dictionary defines attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
caption: Attribute Dictionary
name: dictionary

access_complexity_id.description: The access complexity Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
access_complexity_id.caption: Access Complexity

access_list.description: The list of requested access rights.
access_list.caption: Access List

access_mask.description: The access mask in a platform-native format.
access_mask.caption: Access Mask

access_result.description: The list of access check results.
access_result.caption: Access Check Result

accessed_time.description: The time that the file was last accessed.
accessed_time.caption: Accessed

accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.
accessor.caption: Accessor

account_type.description: The user account type (e.g. AWS, LDAP, Windows account, etc.).
account_type.caption: Account Type ID

account_type_id.description: The user account type identifier (e.g. AWS, LDAP, Windows account, etc.).

-1.description: The user account type is not mapped.
-1.caption: Other

0.description: The user account type is unknown.
0.caption: Unknown

account_type_id.caption: Account Type ID

account_uid.description: The unique identifier of the account(e.g. AWS Account ID).
account_uid.caption: Account UID

activity.description: The original activity that triggered the alert event.
activity.caption: Activity

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the alert event.

-1.description: The event activity is not mapped.
-1.caption: Other

activity_id.caption: Activity ID

actor_process.description: The process that performed the operation or action on the target object. For example, the process that could have created a new file or violated a policy.
actor_process.caption: Actor Process

actual_permissions.description: The permissions that were granted to the in a platform-native format.
actual_permissions.caption: Actual Permissions

additional_malware.description: This object describes additional malware reported in a security finding
additional_malware.caption: Additional Malware

additional_vulnerabilities.description: This object describes additional vulnerabilities reported in a security finding
additional_vulnerabilities.caption: Additional Vulnerbailities

alert.description: The integer value of TLS alert if present. The alerts are defined in the TLS specification in RFC-2246.
alert.caption: Client TLS Alert

algorithm.description: The original hash algorithm, as reported by the event source, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.
algorithm.caption: Algorithm

algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.
1.caption: MD5

2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.
2.caption: SHA-1

3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.
3.caption: SHA-256

4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.
4.caption: SHA-512

5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).
5.caption: CTPH

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID

api.description: API object details information pertaining to the API calls
api.caption: API details

app_name.description: The name of the application that is associated with the event or object.
app_name.caption: Application Name

args.description: The arguments sent along with the HTTP request.
args.caption: HTTP Arguments

assignee.description: The name of the user who is assigned to the incident.
assignee.caption: Assignee

attack_complexity_id.description: The conditions beyond the attacker's control that must exist in order to exploit the vulnerability.
attack_complexity_id.caption: Attack Complexity

attack_vector_id.description: The attack vector Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
attack_vector_id.caption: Attack Vector ID

attacks.description: An array of attacks associated with an event.
attacks.caption: Attacks

attributes.description: The bitmask value that represents the file attributes.
attributes.caption: Attributes

auth_protocol.description: The authentication protocol as reported by the event source.
auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol

auth_protocol_id.description: The authentication protocol used to create the user session.
auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID

authentication_id.description: The authentication Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
authentication_id.caption: Authentication ID

authorization.description: Authorization object provides details related to Authorization
authorization.caption: Authorization Information

availability_impact_id.description: The availability impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
availability_impact_id.caption: Availability Impact ID

base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.
base_address.caption: Base Address

base_score.description: CVSS Base Score in the range of 0.0 to 10.0.
base_score.caption: Base Score

base_vector.description: The base scoring vector for the CVSS score.
base_vector.caption: Base Vector

bits.description: The number of processor bits. For example: 64 or 128.
bits.caption: OS Bits

bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).
bytes.caption: Total Bytes

bytes_in.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.
bytes_in.caption: Bytes In

bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.
bytes_out.caption: Bytes Out

caption.description: A short description or caption of the device. For example: Scanner 1 or Database Manager.
caption.caption: Caption

category.description: The object category. See specific usage.
category.caption: Category

category_ids.description: An array of URL category identifies.

-1.description: The URL category is not mapped. See the categories attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

category_ids.caption: URL Category IDs

category_name.description: The category name of the event.
category_name.caption: Category

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.
category_uid.caption: Category ID

certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.
certificate.caption: Certificate

certificate_chain.description: The Chain of Certificate Serial Numbers field provides a chain of Certificate Issuer Serial Numbers leading to the Root Certificate Issuer.
certificate_chain.caption: Certificate Chain

cis20.description: The CIS 20 is a list of 20 actions and practices an organizationâ€™s security team can take on such that cyber attacks or malware, are minimized and prevented.
cis20.caption: CIS 20 List

class.description: The class name of the object. See specific usage.
class.caption: Class

class_name.description: The class name of the event.
class_name.caption: Class

class_uid.description: The class identifier describes the attributes available in an event. See specific usage.
class_uid.caption: Class ID

classification_ids.description: An array of malware classifications. Reference: STIX Malware Types
classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs

client.description: The client object pertaining to the client/server exchange.
client.caption: Client

client_ciphers.description: The client cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.
client_ciphers.caption: Client Cipher Suites

cloud.description: The cloud where the event was originally created or logged.
cloud.caption: Cloud

cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).
cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition

cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10
cmd_line.caption: Command Line

code.description: The numeric response sent to a HTTP request.
code.caption: Response Code

company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: Microsoft Corporation.
company_name.caption: Company Name

compliance.description: The complaince object describes compliance related details
compliance.caption: Compliance

component.description:
The name or relative pathname of a sub-component of the data object, if applicable.

For example: attachment.doc, attachment.zip/bad.doc, or part.mime/part.cab/part.uue/part.doc.
component.caption: Component

confidence.description: The confidence of the reported finding as a percentage: 0%-100%.
confidence.caption: Confidence

confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence level refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence level means that the detection scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

-1.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID

confidentiality_impact_id.description: The confidentiality impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
confidentiality_impact_id.caption: Confidentiality Impact

content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).
content_type.caption: HTTP Content Type

coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].
coordinates.caption: Coordinates

correlation_uid.description: The unique identifier used to correlate events.
correlation_uid.caption: Correlation UID

count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.
count.caption: Count

country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.
country.caption: Country

create_mask.description: The original Windows mask that is required to create the object.
create_mask.caption: Create Mask

creation_time.description: The time that the object was created. See specific usage.
creation_time.caption: Creation Time

creator.description: The user that created the object associated with event. See specific usage.
creator.caption: Creator

creator_name.description: The name of the user who created the incident.
creator_name.caption: Creator Name

credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.
credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID

criticality.description: Criticality of a resource/object in question
criticality.caption: Criticality

cve_uids.description: The common vulnerabilities and exposures (CVE) unique identifiers.
cve_uids.caption: CVE UIDs

cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.
cvss.caption: CVSS Scores

data.description: The additional data that is associated with the event or object. See specific usage.
data.caption: Data

decision.description: Decision/outcome of the authorization mechanism (e.g. Approved, Denied)
decision.caption: Authorization Decision/Outcome

desc.description: The description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.
desc.caption: Description

desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event
desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display

details.description: Details of an entity. See specific usage
details.caption: Details

detection_end_time.description: The end time of a detection time period.
detection_end_time.caption: Detection Start Time

detection_start_time.description: The start time of a detection time period.
detection_start_time.caption: Detection Start Time

detection_uid.description: The associated unique detection event identifier. For example: detection response events include the Detection ID of the original event.
detection_uid.caption: Detection UID

developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.
developer_uid.caption: Developer UID

device.description: The device that reported the event.
device.caption: Device

direction.description: The direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email.
direction.caption: Direction

direction_id.description: The direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email.

1.description: Inbound, from the Internet or outside network destined for services on the inside network.
1.caption: Inbound

2.description: Outbound, from inside the network destined for services on the Internet or outside network.
2.caption: Outbound

direction_id.caption: Direction ID

dns_id.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.
dns_id.caption: DNS UID

dst_user.description: The user that was a target of an activity.
dst_user.caption: Destination User

duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.
duration.caption: Duration

edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.
edition.caption: OS Edition

end_time.description: The end time of a time period. See specific usage.
end_time.caption: End Time

enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]
enrichments.caption: Enrichments

entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.
entity.caption: Entity

event_name.description: The event name, as defined by the event_uid.
event_name.caption: Event Name

event_source.description: The event source from which the event originates.
event_source.caption: Event Source

event_uid.description: The event ID identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_id * 100 + activity_id.
event_uid.caption: Event ID

exit_code.description: The exit code reported by a process when it terminates. The convention is that zero indicates success and any non-zero exit code indicates that some error occurred.
exit_code.caption: Exit Code

expiration_time.description: The expiration time. See specific usage.
expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time

exposed_port.description: The IP port number exposed by container. For example 0.0.0.0:49155-> <<exposed_port>>/tcp
exposed_port.caption: Port

facility.description: The subsystem or application that is providing the event data.
facility.caption: Facility

facility_detail.description: Additional detail about the source facility. For example, details could include a the name of a particular application instance (such as a database name) or a path to a monitored log file.
facility_detail.caption: Facility Detail

facility_uid.description: The unique identifier of the facility.
facility_uid.caption: Facility UID

feature.description: The feature that reported the event.
feature.caption: Feature

file.description: The file that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.
file.caption: File

file_diff.description: File content differences used for change detection. For example, a common use case is to identify itemized changes within INI or configuration/property setting values.
file_diff.caption: File Diff

file_result.description: The result of the file change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.
file_result.caption: File Result

finding.description: Finding object provides details related to a finding generated by security tool
finding.caption: Finding

fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.
fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint

fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.
fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints

first_occurence.description: Indicates when an entity is first observed.
first_occurence.caption: First Occurence

flag_ids.description: The list of communication flag IDs.
flag_ids.caption: Communication Flag IDs

folder.description: The folder that pertains to the event.
folder.caption: Folder

folder_result.description: The result of the folder change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.
folder_result.caption: Folder Result

full_name.description: The full name of a user.
full_name.caption: Full Name

function_keys.description: The number of function keys on client keyboard.
function_keys.caption: Function Keys

function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.
function_name.caption: Function Name

gateway_ip.description: The gateway IP address. For example: 10.0.0.1.
gateway_ip.caption: Gateway IP Address

gateway_mac.description: The gateway media access control (MAC) address.
gateway_mac.caption: Gateway MAC Address

group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.
group.caption: Group

group_name.description: The name of the group that the resource belongs to.
group_name.caption: Group Name

groups.description: The groups to which an entity belongs. See specific usage.
groups.caption: Groups

handshake_time.description: The amount of total time for the TLS handshake to complete after the TCP connection is established, including client-side delays, in milliseconds.
handshake_time.caption: Handshake Time

hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint or a device.
hostname.caption: Hostname

http_cookies.description: The cookies object describes details about HTTP cookies
http_cookies.caption: HTTP Cookies

http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.
http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers

http_method.description:
The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. Expected values:
  • TRACE
  • CONNECT
  • OPTIONS
  • HEAD
  • DELETE
  • POST
  • PUT
  • GET
http_method.caption: HTTP Method

http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript
http_only.caption: HTTP Only

http_request.description: The HTTP Request made to a web server.
http_request.caption: HTTP Request

http_response.description: The HTTP Response from a web server to a requester.
http_response.caption: HTTP Response

http_status.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned to the client.
http_status.caption: HTTP Status

hw_bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62).
hw_bios_ver.caption: BIOS Version

hw_cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5.
hw_cpu_type.caption: Processor Type

hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.
hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor

identifier_cookie.description: The client identifier cookie during client/server exchange.
identifier_cookie.caption: Identifier Cookie

identity.description: Identity Object details AuthN, AuthZ information pertaining to the event
identity.caption: identity

idp.description: IDP object descivbes details pertaining to the Identity Provider used
idp.caption: Identity Provider

image.description: The image used as a template to run a container or virtual machine.
image.caption: Image

ime.description: The Input Method Editor (IME) file name.
ime.caption: IME

imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.
imei.caption: IMEI

injection_type_id.description: The normalized process injection type identifier.
injection_type_id.caption: Injection Type ID

instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.
instance_uid.caption: Instance ID

integrity_impact_id.description: The integrity impact Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) metric.
integrity_impact_id.caption: Integrity Impact

interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.
interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID

intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.
intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses

internet_connection.description: The internet connection type (e.g. modem, low_broadband, satellite, high_broadband, wan, lan, autodetect).
internet_connection.caption: Internet Connection

invoked_by.description: The name of the service that made the request
invoked_by.caption: Invoked by

ip.description: The IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.
ip.caption: IP Address

is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.
is_cleartext.caption: Cleartext Credentials

is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.
is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device

is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.
is_default.caption: Default Value

is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.
is_managed.caption: Managed Device

is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.
is_on_premises.caption: On Premises

is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.
is_personal.caption: Personal Device

is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.
is_remote.caption: Remote

is_renewal.description: The indication of whether this is a lease/session renewal event.
is_renewal.caption: Renewal

is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.
is_system.caption: System

is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.
is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device

is_user_present.description: The indication of whether the user was logged on at event generation time.
is_user_present.caption: User Present

isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).
isp.caption: ISP

job.description: The job object that pertains to the event.
job.caption: Job

kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity
kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles

kernel.description: The kernel resource object that pertains to the event.
kernel.caption: Kernel

key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.
key_length.caption: Key Length

keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).
keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout

kill_chain_phase_id.description: The Cyber Kill ChainÂ® phase identifier.

0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.
0.caption: Unknown

1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victimâ€™s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.
1.caption: Reconnaissance

2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.
2.caption: Weaponization

3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.
3.caption: Delivery

4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victimâ€™s system.
4.caption: Exploitation

5.description: The intruders install malware on the victimâ€™s system.
5.caption: Installation

6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.
6.caption: Command & Control

7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the missionâ€™s goal.
7.caption: Actions on Objectives

kill_chain_phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID

labels.description: The list of labels attached to an event, object, or attribute.
labels.caption: Labels

lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).
lang.caption: Language

last_occurence.description: Indicates when an entity was most recently observed.
last_occurence.caption: Last Occurence

last_run_time.description: The last run time of application or service. See specific usage.
last_run_time.caption: Last Run

latency.description: TODO: The HTTP response latency. In seconds, milliseconds, etc.?
latency.caption: Latency

lease_time.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events. (activity_id = 1)
lease_time.caption: Lease Time

length.description: The HTTP response length, in number of bytes.
length.caption: Response Length

load_type.description: The load type describes how the module was loaded in memory.
load_type.caption: Load Type

load_type_id.description: The load type identifies how the module was loaded in memory.
load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID

loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.
loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules

location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.
location.caption: Detailed Geo Location

log_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.
log_time.caption: Logged Time

logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.
logon_process.caption: Logon Process

0.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.
0.caption: System

10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.
10.caption: Remote Interactive

11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.
11.caption: Cached Interactive

12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.
12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive

2.description: A local logon to device console.
2.caption: Interactive

3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.
3.caption: Network

4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.
4.caption: Batch

5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.
5.caption: OS Service

8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.
8.caption: Network Cleartext

9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.
9.caption: New Credentials

mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address that is associated with the network interface.
mac.caption: MAC Address

malware.description:
The primary malware identified by the event.

Note: The primary malware may be the first malware found by the detection engine, or it may be the most severe malware found.
malware.caption: Malware

md5.description: The MD5 checksum of the file content.
md5.caption: MD5

metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event.
metadata.caption: Metadata

mfa.description: The Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.
mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication

mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.
mime_type.caption: MIME type

modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.
modified_time.caption: Modified Time

modifier.description: The user that last modified the object associated with the event. See specific usage.
modifier.caption: Modifier

module.description: The module that pertains to the event.
module.caption: Module

name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.
name.caption: Name

namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exists that you need to keep separate.
namespace.caption: Namespace

network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.
network_driver.caption: Network Driver

network_interface.description: The network interface that is associated with the device.
network_interface.caption: Network Interface

network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each MAC address/IP address combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.
network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces

next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.
next_run_time.caption: Next Run

nist.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework recommendations for managing the cybersecurity risk.
nist.caption: NIST List

observables.description: The observables associated with the event.
observables.caption: Observables

opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.
opcode.caption: DNS Opcode

open_mask.description: The Windows options needed to open a registry key.
open_mask.caption: Open Mask

orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, OpenShift, None.
orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator

org_uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization to which the user belongs. For example, Active Directory or AWS Org ID.
org_uid.caption: Org ID

org_unit.description: The name of the organization to which the user belongs.
org_unit.caption: Org Unit

origin.description: The origin of the event, where the event was created.
origin.caption: Origin

other_malware.description: The additional malware that was detected.
other_malware.caption: Other Malware

outcome.description: The outcome of the event, as defined by the event source.
outcome.caption: Outcome

outcome_id.description: The outcome ID of the event.
outcome_id.caption: Outcome ID

owner.description: The user that owns the file.
owner.caption: Owner

owner_name.description: The name of the service or user account that owns the resource.
owner_name.caption: Owner Name

packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product
packages.caption: Related Packages

packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).
packets.caption: Total Packets

packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.
packets_in.caption: Packets In

packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.
packets_out.caption: Packets Out

parent_categories.description: An array of parent URL categories.
parent_categories.caption: Parent Categories

parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32
parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder

parent_process.description: The parent process of the actor process.
parent_process.caption: Parent Process

path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.
path.caption: Path

peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.
peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device

permission.description: The IAM permission related to an event
permission.caption: Permission

physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.
physical_height.caption: Physical Height

physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.
physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation

physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.
physical_width.caption: Physical Width

pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.
pid.caption: Process ID

port.description: The IP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.
port.caption: Port

postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.
postal_code.caption: Postal Code

priority.description: The original priority, as defined by the data source.
priority.caption: Priority

priority_id.description: The normalized priority. See specific usage.
priority_id.caption: Priority ID

privileges_required_id.description: The level of privileges an attacker must possess before successfully exploiting the vulnerability.
privileges_required_id.caption: Privileges Required

processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.
processed_time.caption: Processed Time

product.description: The product that reported the event.
product.caption: Product

profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event.
profiles.caption: Profiles

protocol_name.description: The TCP/IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: tcp or udp.
protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name

protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.
protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number

provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.
provider.caption: Provider

proxy.description: If a proxy connection is present, the connection from the client to the proxy server.
proxy.caption: Proxy

public_ip.description:
The public IP address.

Note: The Device Public IP is populated with the value of the x-forwarded-for message header, if present.

.
public_ip.caption: Public IP

quarantine_uid.description: The unique identifier of the item that was quarantined or restored from quarantine.
quarantine_uid.caption: Quarantine UID

query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.
query_string.caption: HTTP Query String

query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.
query_time.caption: Query Time

raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.
raw_data.caption: Raw Data

rcode.description: The DNS server response code. See RFC-6895.
rcode.caption: Response Code

rcode_id.description: The DNS server response code id. See RFC-6895.
rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID

-1.description: The dns response code is not defined by the RFC.
-1.caption: Other

6.description: Name Exists when it should not.
6.caption: YXDomain

7.description: RR Set Exists when it should not.
7.caption: YXRRSet

8.description: RR Set that should exist does not.
8.caption: NXRRSet

9.description: Not Authorized or Server Not Authoritative for zone.
9.caption: NotAuth

16.description: TSIG Signature Failure or Bad OPT Version.
16.caption: BADSIG_VERS

24.description: The codes deemed to be unassigned by the RFC (unassigned codes: 12-15, 24-3840, 4096-65534).
24.caption: Unassigned

25.description: The codes deemed to be reserved by the RFC (codes: 3841-4095, 65535).
25.caption: Reserved

rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.
rdata.caption: DNS RData

ref_event_code.description: The event code/ID, as defined by the event source. It is used to identify the type of event. For example, the Windows event Code or ID.
ref_event_code.caption: Reference Event Code

ref_event_name.description: The event name, as defined by the event source.
ref_event_name.caption: Reference Event Name

ref_event_uid.description: The event instance identifier, as defined by the event source. It is the index of the event in an external event log. For example, the Windows EventRecordID.
ref_event_uid.caption: Reference Event ID

ref_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source.
ref_time.caption: Original Time

ref_uid.description: The reference to a unique identifier, managed by an external system.
ref_uid.caption: Reference UID

referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.
referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer

reg_key_result.description: The result of the registry key change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.
reg_key_result.caption: Registry Key Result

reg_value_result.description: The result of the registry value change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.
reg_value_result.caption: Registry Value Result

region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.
region.caption: Region

related_findings.description: Describes findings related to a finding as identified by the security product.
related_findings.caption: Related Findings

related_vulns.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.
related_vulns.caption: Related Vulnerabilities

relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.
relay.caption: Relay

remediation_details.description: The Remediation object describes details about recommended remediation strategies.
remediation_details.caption: Remediation Details

remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event
remote_display.caption: Remote Display

rep_score.description: The original reputation score as reported by the event source.
rep_score.caption: Reputation Score

-1.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.
4.caption: Leans Safe

5.description: No established history of normal behavior.
5.caption: May not be Safe

6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.
6.caption: Exercise Caution

request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage
request.caption: API Request Details

requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that were requested by the process.
requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions

requirements.description: A list of applicable compliance requirements for which this finding is related to.
requirements.caption: Requirements

resolved_ip.description: The resolved IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, Layer 4 load balancer translated IP address.
resolved_ip.caption: IP Address

resources.description: A list of resources associated to an event.
resources.caption: Resources Array

resource_type.description: The context in which a resource was retrieved in a web request.
resource_type.caption: Resource Type

resource_uid.description: The unique identifier of a cloud resource. For example, S3 Bucket name, EC2 Instance Id.
resource_uid.caption: Resource ID

response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.
response.caption: API Response Details

response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.
response_time.caption: Response Time

risk.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) calculated risk.
risk.caption: Risk

risk_score.description: The original risk score as reported by the event source.
risk_score.caption: Risk Score

rule.description: The rules that reported the events.
rule.caption: Rule

run_as.description: The user account the process is running as.
run_as.caption: Run-As User

run_state.description: The state of the job or service. See specific usage.
run_state.caption: Run State

run_state_id.description: The state of the job or service. See specific usage.
run_state_id.caption: Run State ID

samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None
samesite.caption: SameSite

sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.
sandbox.caption: Sandbox

sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.
sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names

scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.
scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor

scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.
scheme.caption: Scheme

secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.
secure.caption: Secure

sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.
sequence.caption: Sequence Number

serial.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.
serial.caption: Serial Number

server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.
server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites

service.description: The cloud service that pertains to the event.
service.caption: Service

session_uid.description: The unique ID of the user session, as reported by the OS.
session_uid.caption: Session UID

severity.description:
The original event severity, as defined by the event source.

The severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident.
severity.caption: Severity

severity_id.description:
The normalized event severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

-1.description: The event severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

0.description: The event severity is not known.
0.caption: Unknown

2.description: The user decides if action is needed.
2.caption: Low

3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.
3.caption: Medium

5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.
5.caption: Critical

6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.
6.caption: Fatal

severity_id.caption: Severity ID

sha1.description: The SHA-1 checksum of the file content.
sha1.caption: SHA-1

sha2.description: The SHA-256 checksum of the file content.
sha2.caption: SHA-256

signature.description: The digital signature of the file.
signature.caption: Digital Signature

size.description: The size of data, in bytes.
size.caption: Size

sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.
sni.caption: Server Name Indication

sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.
sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack

sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.
sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version

src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.
src_url.caption: Source URL

src_user.description: The existing user from which an activity was initiated.
src_user.caption: Source User

start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.
start_time.caption: Start Time

state.description: The state of the event or object, as defined by the event source. See specific usage.
state.caption: State

state_id.description: The state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.
state_id.caption: State ID

status.description: The event status, as reported by the event source.
status.caption: Status

status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event outcome.
status_detail.caption: Status Details

status_id.description: The cross-platform normalized status of the activity or alert reported by the event.

-1.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

status_id.caption: Status ID

subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.
subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID

supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool
supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data

svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.
svc_name.caption: Service Name

system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.
system_call.caption: System Call

tactics.description: The a list of tactic ID's that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.
tactics.caption: Tactics

tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).
tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags

technique_name.description: The name of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Drive-by Compromise.
technique_name.caption: Technique Name

technique_uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1189.
technique_uid.caption: Technique ID

termination_time.description: The time that the entity was terminated. See specific usage.
termination_time.caption: Termination Time

tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.
tid.caption: Thread ID

time.description:
The normalized event occurrence time

Note: The format is yet undecided
time.caption: Event Time

timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.
timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset

title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.
title.caption: Title

traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.
traffic.caption: Traffic

traffic_path.description: The boundary of the connection. For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-path (same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.
traffic_path.caption: Traffic Path

traffic_path_id.description: The boundary of the connection. For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-path (same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.

1.description: Local network traffic on the same endpoint.
1.caption: Local

10.description: Through a gateway VPC endpoint (Nitro-based instances only)
10.caption: Gateway VPC

11.description: Through an Internet gateway (Nitro-based instances only)
11.caption: Internet Gateway

2.description: Internal network traffic between two endpoints inside network.
2.caption: Internal

3.description: External network traffic between two endpoints on the Internet or outside the network.
3.caption: External

4.description: Through another resource in the same VPC
4.caption: Same VPC

5.description: Through an Internet gateway or a gateway VPC endpoint
5.caption: Internet/VPC Gateway

7.description: Through an intra-region VPC peering connection
7.caption: Intra-region VPC

8.description: Through an inter-region VPC peering connection
8.caption: Inter-region VPC

traffic_path_id.caption: Traffic Path ID

transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.
transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID

ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.
ttl.caption: TTL

type.description: The type of an object or value. See specific usage.
type.caption: Type

type_id.description: The type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

-1.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.
-1.caption: Other

type_id.caption: Type ID

types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.
types.caption: Types

uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.
uid.caption: Unique ID

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.
unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data

update_time.description: A Timestamp indicating when an entity was last updated.
update_time.caption: Update Time

url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.
url.caption: URL

user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.
user.caption: User

user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.
user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent

user_interaction_id.description: The requirement for a user, other than the attacker, to participate in the successful compromise of the vulnerable component.
user_interaction_id.caption: User Interaction

user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.
user_result.caption: User Result

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.
uuid.caption: UUID

value.description: The value that pertains to the object. See specific usage.
value.caption: Value

vendor.description: The vendor that pertains to the object. See specific usage.
vendor.caption: Vendor

version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.
version.caption: Version

vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID

vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability
vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability

x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.
x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For

xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.
xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes

zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.
zone.caption: Network Zone

types.description: The predefined data types. The data type specifies what kind of data a value can have.
types.caption: Data Types

file_hash_t.description: File hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file.
file_hash_t.caption: File Hash

hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.
hostname_t.caption: Hostname

ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.
ip_t.caption: IP Address

json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.
json_t.caption: JSON

mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.
mac_t.caption: MAC Address

object_t.description: Object is an unordered set of name/value pairs. For example: {ip: 92.24.47.250, type: IP Address}
object_t.caption: Object

path_t.description: File or folder full path name. For example: /home/user/tmp/text-file.txt.
path_t.caption: Path Name

port_t.description: IP TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.
port_t.caption: IP Port

resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.
resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID

subnet_t.description: Subnet mask in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. For example 192.168.200.0/24.
subnet_t.caption: Subnet

timestamp_t.description: The time format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.
timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp

url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.
url_t.caption: URL String
